description: An ancient Sicilian city located on the northern coast of the island, founded by Ducetius in 446 B.C.

properties.description: Location of the modern Sicilian town of Caronia, thought to be in the area of the ancient settlement of Calacte, based on a representative point derived from an OpenStreetMap node
properties.title: OSM location of Caronia

history.comment: Location updates and tags from Johan Ahlfeldt's (jahlfeldt) Digital Atlas of the Roman Empire in October 2012
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012

history.comment: Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012

names.details: Calacte is listed as "Caronia" in the BTCGI. The association between the ancient and the modern place is also supported in the Barrington Atlas and in Manni (1981).

references.formattedCitation: Wikipedia: L’enciclopedia libera e collaborativa (2001-), Caronia.
